title-part.text: VEHICLES, VEHICLE FITTINGS, OR VEHICLE PARTS, NOT OTHERWISE PROVIDED FOR

note.note-paragraph: Attention is drawn to the Note following the title of class B60
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: Optical viewing arrangements

reference.text: antiglare equipment, e.g. polarising, for windscreens or windows B60J3/00;

CPC-specific-text.text: integrated in the windows, e.g. Fresnel lenses
specially adapted for covering the peripheral part of the vehicle, e.g. for viewing tyres, bumpers or the like

reference.text: integrated in the windows B60R1/001; combined with rear-view mirrors B60R1/08

CPC-specific-text.text: Side-view mirrors, e.g. V-shaped mirrors located at the front or rear part of the vehicle

reference.text: combined with rear-view mirrors B60R1/08; side-view periscopes B60R1/10

CPC-specific-text.text: specially adapted for covering the lateral blind spot not covered by the usual rear-view mirror
allowing the driver to see passengers, e.g. for busses

title-part.text: Rear-view mirror arrangements

CPC-specific-text.text: comprising special mechanical means for correcting the field of view in relation to particular driving conditions, e.g. change of lane; scanning mirrors

title-part.text: mounted inside vehicle
mounted on vehicle exterior

CPC-specific-text.text: comprising means for cleaning or deicing
specially adapted for mounting on trucks, e.g. by C-shaped support means
by manually actuated mechanical means, e.g. push-pull cables
by hydraulically or pneumatically actuated means
foldable along the vehicle, e.g. in case of external force applied thereon

for adjusting the mirror relative to its housing
using cables
by electrically powered actuators
for adjusting the mirror relative to its housing
for retracting the mirror arrangements to a non-use position alongside the vehicle
yieldable to excessive external force and provided with an indexed use position
easily removable
mounted for bodily outward movement, e.g. when towing
involving special optical features, e.g. avoiding blind spots

CPC-specific-text.text: , e.g. convex mirrors; Side-by-side associations of rear-view and other mirrors
avoiding blind spots, e.g. by using a side-by-side association of mirrors
using a single wide field mirror or an association of rigidly connected mirrors
using a removable filtering or hiding screen

CPC-specific-text.text: using a combination of interchangeable reflecting surfaces, e.g. reversible mirrors

using a mirror angularly movable between a position of use and a non-glare position reflecting a dark field to the user, e.g. situated behind a transparent glass used as low-reflecting surface; Wedge-shaped mirrors
with remote or automatic control means
using a cell of electrically changeable optical characteristic, e.g. liquid-crystal or electrochromic mirrors
using a liquid filtering layer of variable thickness
